intro: Sterculia setigera, commonly known as the Australian hibiscus, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to northern Australia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and red. The plant has palmate leaves with five to seven lobes, and its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils.
